result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E. Estep was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Deft Reck paid $500 towards  Sam's Club -  $1307.32, leaving a balance of $807.32  to be paid between Rachel Fehl and Charles E Estep.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  
+  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).  
+ Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges, with Co -Defts  Rachel Fehl & Katie Reck - Joint and Severally.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years consecutive to count 2 of 92CF674.  See conditions.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amounts of $2375.05, $4215.84, & $1307.32.  Restitution amount of $1307.32 (Sam's Club) is jointly/severally with w/co-defts Rachel Fehl & Katie Reck.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
Restitution in the amount of $1307.32 with Co deft's Rachel N Fehl and Katie L Reck.
For Restitution Order - filed by ADA J Kraus.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Defense requests waiver of PSI.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Defense moves for waiver of PSI.  Brief discussion held.  Court denies the request.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/9/16 @ 11am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Atty D. Caspari with DE, in custody. Clerk R. Matoska-Mentink
Pleas of not guilty entered. Bond continued
Petrial 2/4/16 @ 9:30
Jury Selection 2/22/16 @ 9:00

141PM  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk JThwing. DE appeared in custody with Atty Diane Caspari.   Atty Margaret Dress appeared for the prosecution.   Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bond continued.
